Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and enjoyed every one of them. The location is a little different but with a car, its fine. Restaurants in the area are few but Beepers is fun. The hotel does have two restaurants but we only ate there the three days we were part of an Exploritas Program. There is even a laundromat across the street. The staff at this hotel, which is not part of a chain, is exceptionally friendly and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying here”
Reviews.Author: owlcoast
Reviews.Content: Love staying here. Suites are roomy - bigger than at DoubleTree. And with pullout couch in living room, kids can stay in one room while parents stay in another. They actually have real cribs for young kids - as opposed to Pak N Play - which means parents can wheel kids from one room to another if needed. Only other hotel I've seen with real cribs is Four Seasons. Our kids like seeing the airplanes takeoff and land - and so do I!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireRammie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Airtel Plaza twice. The first time being September 2008. On returning this year we found the hotel had been upgraded with the addition of a pool & restaurant. Both these added to an already first class hotel. The food and service in the restaurant was first class and along with the hotel can be thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff were OUTSTANDING - both professional and personal”
Reviews.Author: tuitionforkids
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be disappointed in this hotel because it was not a standard "brand" hotel where I have stayed on other trips to Los Angeles. Boy, was I happy! Everyone from the front office staff who remembered my name every day when I returned to the hotel from meetings to the housekeeping staff who were always on their toes and helpful with anything I would ask them for. What a pleasure to travel to the Airtel! I will be back again when business brings me to the San Fernando Valley, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with 1st Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Felicia3P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Thanksgiving weekend. Although we live in Anaheim, we wanted to have a Staycation during the long holiday weekend. We wanted to stay somewhere in Los Angeles where we can be central to everything. The final decision came down to the Airtel Plaza Hotel. It was the best value and the perfect location for our planned visits to Universal Studios and Magic Mountain. Although there was not much to do within walking distance, the short drive in any direction took you to your destination. One of the fun things we did was to take the new Orange Metro Line to Universal Studios. My kids had never taken the bus before so it was very exciting to them. The bus fare for the entire family was less then what we would have paid for parking. The North Hollywood station took you right to the foot steps of Universal. We took a fun ride up a large hill to get to the park. The best part was that the hotel had a courtesy shuttle to the Metro Orange Line Station. It was one of the most pain free amusement park days ever. I mentioned the 1st class service on the title. I've stayed in many hotels for business and pleasure and customer service is a major factor in how I write my reviews. The staff at the Airtel Plaza Hotel is one of the best I've encountered in all the years. They treat you like your a guest in their home. Everyone I encountered was friendly and most helpful. If I have to stay in Los Angeles again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, my first choice the next time I'm in LA”
Reviews.Author: Family_Guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while on vacation. We got a great deal on Priceline and our room was very nice. compared to other hotels in the area, the rooms (at least ours) are large and comfy. We chose to stay in this area while doing hollywood vacation stuff and we were glad we did. you just get more value here then the hollywood area hotel we stayed at first. They charge 10 bucks for parking at the Airtel which is less then many hotels but I thought this was silly since they have so much parking avalible. They even rope off sections of the parking lot so you are forced to pay to park in the back - I mean come on! I should however give this hotel thumbs up for free internet! Paid parking aside, this is a great hotel, the other reviews on this site are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYTRAVELLERS55_9
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel for short stay,clean,nice restaurant, nice small pool. Small private airport next door, creates a lot of noise. Good small diner just round corner, sit in or take away, good quality, large portions, very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visiting CSUN”
Reviews.Author: LaurieASanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights to visit college son at CSUN and attend his performances. Staff was very nice and helpful, Traveled with my 16 year old son and his friend. The room was decent size for us. We requested a room with a view of the airport and runway and were very happy with it although the beds are a little hard. The windows open so we could get fresh air or close the window and not hear almost anything from the planes. We didn't visit the restaurant so I don't know how the food there is. I did pick up coffee and pastries on our last morning there. The caramel macchiato at the little place in the lobby was awesome! Best coffee I've had! When I asked at the front desk about the 12 o'clock check out time and that I was trying to get the boys moving but we might be a few minutes late, they responded that it was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great value, free internet”
Reviews.Author: JenMcCool
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel ater reading other reviews and I'm glad I did as the hotel was absolutely wonderful. Our standard room was huge and the staff were all friendly and helpful. It was quiet for being on an airport and had a great night sleep too. We had a blast at the comedy night Saturday night (it was like being in Vegas) at their Lounge. If you can come for the weekend, this is a must see show! Food at their beautiful restaurant was also terrific and generous. Location was handy to metro...we took the metro for $2.50 to Universal Studios and Hollywood and their free hotel shuttled us to/from the station. I wanted to share to the readers of our fabulous experience! Great location to everything.Can't wait to return to this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Clean”
Reviews.Author: Nathug_7
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this Hotel, October 30- November 3, 2009. The hotel is very clean, breakfast is great and cost is very reasonable. We booked through Travelocity and got free parking and breakfast. I highly recomend this hotel. Noise from airport only when windows are open. Good Value.. have a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly, helpful staff, rooms were also nice”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Very helpful in giving directions. Hotel is located right next to the Van Nuys Airport, the planes are noisy when outside by the pool, but sound is muffled in the rooms. The rooms are very nice and fairly large. Free wireless internet, also free ethernet cable. Comfortable beds, large sink/counter (which is outside the bathroom w/toilet and shower. The shower head wasn't too great - weird settings, not much water pressure. Not many restaurants or places to see within walking distance. You definitely need a car, but parking is $9.00/day. There are nicer neighborhoods in the Valley but the hotel and staff are very nice. Alot of meeting rooms and big conference center

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and free internet a surprise bonus.”
Reviews.Author: tinapai18
Reviews.Content: Great value for a solid 3 star hotel! Staff were all friendly, informative and helpful. The design of their newly remodeled restaurant was warm and the food was great. Ended our evening at their very cool, exotic bar which had Asian touches. I stay here when I am in the area and the service is always consistent. Highly recommend if you are in the San Fernando Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: ONTHEMOVE_9
Reviews.Content: I wasnâ€™t expecting a lot for $129 in Los Angeles but this hotel far exceeded my expectations. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The hotel was equipped with a heated Pool, Spa and workout room which I couldnâ€™t keep my kids out of. The Hotel had a reasonably priced restaurant actually a good value considering how good the food was. The best part of our stay was the overall welcomed feeling my family received by the staff; they were just all so helpful and polite, Can wait to return to the Van Nuys area again!! Sincerely, Mike D.

Reviews.Title: “Good place...good priceline value”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Airtel pretty frequently when I am in CA. Overall its a solid price (great value using priceline, $60) and has a nice restuarant and bar. The rooms are large, with a nice desk area and large bed. Its right near the Van Nuys airport and close to the 405. This it not some plush Marriott, but its on par with a Radisson and chains like that. I give it a a solid 4 stars for the priceline value I get and the nice bar on site.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great value”
Reviews.Author: xmascolors
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel repeatedly for both business and pleasure, and found it to be a great value. The rooms are spacious, clean, and nicely decorated, and include a desk and computer docking station. The rooms are quiet, the staff friendly, and the hotel has a great bar, and nice landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Evacuation Center”
Reviews.Author: Mimi079
Reviews.Content: My family was quickly evacuated last week due to the Sesnon Fire. We were not home when they evacuated so needless to say we had no clothes, underwear, toiletries, etc. We waited until 9:00 p.m. to see if we would be allowed to go home but were told that we would not be able to access our home at all. We called other local hotels who quoted us ridiculously high rates, even though we told them we were evacuation victims. The Airtel was so helpful when we called, they quoted us a great rate, supplied us with toothbrushes, razors, toothpaste, soap, etc. They held our room for us while we went to work and even gave us coupons for the breakfast buffet (I have two kids who had to get to school). They simply went out of their way to ease our minds and make us as comfortable as possible. The next day, they held our room until we found out if we were able to go home or not, we were not, so they extended their hospitality to us for another day and gave us breakfast coupons for the next day as well. There were some other evacuated families there as well who had the same great experience that we had. I want to thank the entire staff and management for coming to our rescue in our hour of need and being so gracious and accomodating during a very trying time for our community.

Reviews.Title: “simple at the airtel plaza”
Reviews.Author: bispu
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in june 2008 , room facing front of building, clean and tidy , bathroom fine , no issues. usesd bar in evening which was never over busy , comfortable surroundings and reasonable prices for the drinks, eat for one night in Restaurant which was not as expected , the lady who lead us to our table was a little more interested in her private phone call , so she kept us waiting , she took us to our table and sped off, there was only 1 other person in the room, we waited 20 minutes for a waiter to take our requirements, the Tuna which was ordered was awful , it was raw , apparently the Chef advised through the waiter that it was served that way in the Hotel, it was inedible and they did not charge.. Breakfast was Buffet style and was fine , every thing was fresh and the waiters very polite and helpful , they were tipped, suffice to say the previous evening they missed out. A swimming pool is sited to the rear of the Hotel , very nice ,warm and when we visited plenty of room, there is also a hot tub to enjoy, it is hot so be warned.Right next to the Hotel is the Van Nuys Airport , with private jet planes flying in and out , I can not remember hearing them at night. It is a pleasant simple Hotel and I would have no hesitation in revisiting in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The 'No Frills' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tminton
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills but good hotel. You can get a great rate but you will pay for any extras. I got a rate of $69.00 through Priceline and that was far below what the other hotels are averaging. You will be charged $10 a day for parking, $3 for internet usage (free wireless though), no provided breakfast, and 1 cup of coffee in maker provided in the room. I also asked for a courtesey upgrade to a suite since none were occupied but was quickly denied unless I wanted to pay. The hotel itself was very clean and I was impressed that the maintenece staff took as much pride on the outside grounds as they did on the inside. The airport next door is extremely busy and sometimes the small jets were very loud but never noticed the noise during the night. I was usually awakend around 6 or 7 am by aircraft. The two spas by the courtyard were well maintained and the courtyard itself was very nice. The main pool is quite a walk though from the tower rooms. I also believe the tower rooms are much bigger and better for a family. The beds were very nice as well. We never heard noise from any other room but that is usually dependent on who is next to you. I did not have a problem with the neighborhood. It seemed safe enough and the parking lot was secured nicely with a paid parking attendant. We really did not find any restaurants in the area that we wanted to visit. The area is aging as well as the eating places. If you are flying into LAX and taking the Flyaway to the hotel, get ready to walk. I might walk if I was by myself and carrying a duffle bag. Otherwise, be sure you have transport to the hotel. I am guessing a half of a mile or more. Getting in and out of the hotel lot was very easy. You are about a mile or two to the 405 and traffic to the highway was never an issue. We visited Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Venice Beach and Universal Studios. It took about 20 minutes to get to Hollywood. Traffic was always heavy but moving. It was actually a nice trip through the mountains. I would suggest this hotel if you are willing to drive a little. We spent 4 days there and I ended up using a little more than half of tank of gas going to all the places I mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to land unexpectedly”
Reviews.Author: madriax
Reviews.Content: I had not expected to get a hotel on this trip but wound up staying here on a whim, because some friends were already booked here. The staff was uber-courteous, found me a great rate for a well-appointed and spotlessly clean room. This isn't the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in, but for a room that was across the hallway from the elevator it was far better than expected. I'd stay there again without thinking twice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Birdmombjk
Reviews.Content: Pros and cons: Couldn't check in early, told to come back at 3 and the room still wasn't ready. Parking was $10 a day. The room was large and nicely decorated. Great mattress and linens were excellent. The bathroom is HUGE! Everything was clean and modern. Small jacuzzi's were nice and located in a lovely setting. Larger jacuzzi and pool were also available. Right next to the airport and corporate jets parked right next to the hotel but we were NOT bothered by any noise whatsoever. This is a real nice place, away from downtown LA, and very easy to get to. The price was excellent for the value. My only complaint was stated in the first sentence and I could live with that. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola34
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it here - no complaints about the hotel whatsoever - clean, comfortable, spacious, staff couldn't be nicer - the rooms are lovely and we are very glad we stayed here. Superb deal and would receommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great and comfy place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: LAHotel
Reviews.Content: That was my first visit in LA, and I am glad that I have had such a great experience at Airtel plaza hotel. The most important thing for me is being somewhere I can feel like home, and Airtel plaza hotel made me feel exactly like my home. I know this hotel is not fancy, but you don't have to BUY the hotel, you just need to stay somewhere comfy and just relaxing! I will be back definitely sometimes on May 2008! Thanks to all staff and their friendly service, see you on May! M&J

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise in Van Nuys”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: Ever since I was a kid, I have loved watching planes. So take this review with a grain of salt, because the Airtel Plaza Hotel speaks right to my aeronautical infatuation. However, even if this property was located somewhere else and not done up with some of the airplane kitsch, I'd still think it was a pretty pleasant place to stay. My room appeared to be fairly recently remodeled. The decor was pleasing ... a nod toward modern minimalism, yet comfortable. One can tell that before the remodel this was probably a pretty standard large motel-type property. The renovations, though, have made this property quite comfortable. There are a few items that still seem a bit cheap: the plastic surround shower/bath, wood veneer doors, dresser drawers that looked a bit out of place, the low-quality A/C heater unit below the windows. But those are minor. The room was comfy with a bed with great linens and pillows and a desk with a nice ergonomic desk chair. Bath linens were fine ... not the fluffiest or whitest, but just fine. Carpet was clean and seemed pretty new. I did order a pizza from room service, which was pretty tasty and delivered within 20 minutes. I'll definitely try to stay at the Airtel Plaza again when the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: corvete001
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Reseda, CA. for business and this was the hotel that was close to the area. I wasn't very sure about the property and was very uneasy. All I can say is I was wrong. The property was excellent. It was very clean and safe. Parking was very good and the staff was excellent. Most of all the room was spotless. Ordered room service and it was prompt and hot when it arrived. You can't go wrong this this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Hotel on Western Explorer Tour of America”
Reviews.Author: BinkyUK
Reviews.Content: This was the first Hotel stop on our itinerary of a Coach Tour of America, it was near to the Airport, I guess the Tour operator felt having flown for 11 hours he had better get us booked in to a Hotel asap... I can honestly say that this Hotel was very good, first time in America for us and a two night stay here before travelling on was the itinerary, we had free breakfast's here and they where absolutely yummy !! in fact the food at this Hotel spoilt the rest of the trip because no one else's breakfast's lived up to theirs. We also had their B-B-Q evening meal which was excellent value Steak, Salad, Jacket Potatoe's followed by apple pie and ice cream for Â£10. The bedrooms ,as we where to find out on our journey where HUGE compared to Europe and of a good standard and comfortable. This Hotel is fine for a few days around the LA area I cannot comment on how easy it is to get into LA because we had an organised tour and where taken by coach to various points of interest. I

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: jgsenecal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the evening of August 24, in room 340, traveling on business. I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Its main attractions are probably that it (1) is right next to the Van Nuys airport, and it (2) is in the Los Angeles area. So, unless you have a need to be right at the Van Nuys airport (to catch an early flight the next morning, say) or you really like aircraft, you'd probably do better somewhere else. The room I stayed in was comfortable and had basic amenities. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. I didn't care for the decor, nor the style of the bed (ugly headboard). The room and bathroom were very clean, and everything functioned. Being at the Van Nuys airport the hotel lobby naturally has an airplane motif: Pan Am posters and other nostalgia everywhere. Very nice to look at! I really liked the large, articulated model of a Boeing 747 hanging from the ceiling. Other miscellaneous items: breakfast was not provided, and parking was $9. I'm told charging for parking is "normal" for the area, but there are certain levels of hospitality I expect. Charging someone to stay in the hotel, then charging them to park their vehicle, is a little low in my book. The bottom line is: I've paid less and received more at other places. Disclaimer: This review, and the material and opinions presented therein, is mine, and not my employer's.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, but mostly average”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for location only. I had work in the valley and this was a central location. Plus, there really is nothing else in the valley that would be better. The room was adequate, nothing special. Bed was decent. Everything was clean and the sheets and towels were of good quality. As a pilot I kind of appreciated the 'Airplane theme' and the proximity to the Van Nuys Airport, its out the back door. The kids will love it. I never noticed the plane noise, but was in a room facing away from the runways. The cleaning staff was hit or miss. The first day I had a newspaper and the room was cleaned well. The second day, no paper and the bed was half made. No big deal, but not great service. There is free WiFi in the entire hotel which is cool and the parking was $9/day. Reasonable by LA standards, but annoying when you are paying $150/night for a room. The restaurant is decent but a bit overpriced, basically hotel prices. There are several restaurants about 3 miles away on Ventura Blvd. Chilis, Buca, Sushi and others. Nothing real close to the hotel except for Subway, McD's and Jack in the Box. There are a few Starbucks in the area but the cafe in the lobby has excellent coffee so I just bought it there. All in all a decent hotel, nothing to write home about, but nothing horrible. If you have kids and need to be in the valley I would briing them here just to watch the planes, what kid doesnt love planes?

Reviews.Title: “somewhat of a rough landing”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just ok. Some of the rooms have been refurbished, and they are decent. However, when one comes off the elevator, there is no arrow pointing to the direction of the rooms. The guest is left to guess, and this hotel has many hallways. Also, there is no sign directing you to the lobby. This hotel is not in the greatest area. There are NO decent places to eat anywhere close, unless you want to take a chance and eat at the nearby "Kitty Club"(no thanks)! I also really resent that you have to pay $9 to park. I suggest you drive a few more exits off of the 405 for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Van Nuys”
Reviews.Author: Max-Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best hotel in Van Nuys, CA. We have stayed here many times to visit family in the area. We use our AAA discount (the desk requests to see your AAA card at time of check-in). The rooms are generously sized and clean. The restaurant serves a good breakfast. We were pleased to see the addition of a coffee bar in the lobby during this last visit. The only negative is that this hotel is adjacent to the Van Nuys airport (thus the name Airtel). There is a partial curfew from 11PM to 7AM prohibiting aircraft departure (no curfew on landings). We were awaken around 6:30AM by the airport noise each morning - the jets are quite loud. Getting an early start each day did allow us more time for tourist activities and visiting relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is better then this dump!”
Reviews.Author: aliciastar
Reviews.Content: My company sent me out to stay here. the service was terrible, the staff sucked! the food was over priced for the quality and just an over all bad experience, there were flys in the restaurant and dirty linens.. once we checked in, the hotel room smelled of mold. my wife and i looked at eachother and did not want to be there the next day we checked out and went to the hilton a few blocks down where the price was maybe $20 bucks more but the quality was 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a wow!”
Reviews.Author: kayedeedid
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel in Van Nuys.....The property is upscale and the staff is professional and very friendly!!! The restaurant is a class act...great food and again, upscale service.....an added treat to all this is being so close to the Van Nuys Airport and watching the beautiful Lear jets....I and friends will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Always have”
Reviews.Author: misnvegas9
Reviews.Content: The Airtel is what you make it. Although an older hotel, and yes some of the rooms are dated it really takes you into another world, aviation. I was in one of their suites with the jacuzzi on the outdoor patio overlooking the airport runway, absolutely wonderful! My husband and I sometimes just go there to get away from it all. The food is wonderful and the staff too. It's our own secret getaway. Not much within walking distance, however lots to do with transportation. Recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Smells Moldy in the Rooms and Hallways”
Reviews.Author: firstinla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last month, the place is old and outdated, as i was walking down the hallway it smelled of mold... and the smell got worse in the sleeping room, the wallpaper is chipping and the carpets are stained, there are nicer motels out there than this hotel, i was very disapointed that i got this hotel through priceline. will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos!”
Reviews.Author: epaz
Reviews.Content: Came in for a wedding reception. From the moment I made my reservations I knew this is the place to stay. Property is very clean and beautiful. The Bell Staff and Front Desk were very friendly, Gary has a great smile!!. Kudos to the entire staff. The banquet facilities were great and food was delicious! I defintely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Burgh_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Airtel in January and really liked it. The rooms were comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The best part for us was the restaurant. Its got a great view of the airport, but the suprise was the menu. The food was high end and didn't break the bank. My wife's favorite part was the bed.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to let all of you out there know that this hotel is great. Priceline booked me here so I didn't chose it myself. Afterwards, I read the reviews on this site and I became terrified. I was even prepared to bring my own sheets and pillows cuz I got so freaked out. I don't know where these ppl stayed but I had a great stay. I want to point out that I am THE MOST germ-phobic spaz there is and this place was clean and didn't "creep me out" like most hotels do. Yes, it could stand to have new carpet but who cares?? It was clean and the staff was great. We had a room with 2 queen's and the room was a good size, as well as the bathroom and sink area. The only complaint I have is that the room-service food was ok. Nothing that great but get over it. DO NOT BE AFRAID TO STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: FionaJM
Reviews.Content: VERY close to Van Nuys airport. Planes land/take-off until at least 1 am then start again at approx. 7am. This was not mentioned at all either on website or upon check-in. Rooms were spacious (but outdated) although they were clean and water pressure was good. It was a long walk to our room as well but we were warned about that. Wireless was abit hit and miss with conncetivity. I found the charge to print in the business centre steep ($3 min payment for computer time THEN another .50c per page). If you need to stay near the airport you cannot get any closer, access to the 405 was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but shows it's age”
Reviews.Author: Trinnypilot
Reviews.Content: Good value - pilots get a deep discount. Convenient location for Van Nuys airport and 405 freeway Also close to bus service to LAX, but surrounding area is dismal. Rooms are clean enough and has free wired and wireless internet. No carts for luggage. Parking is $8 per night. Hotel also has a shop and on site Enterprise car rental. Also dining and a bar. Included breakfast was good and available well past 9 o'clock as posted. Friendly staff. Hotel shows it's age and needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in serious need of cleaning, and the hotel actually requested the guests to reuse towels and bed linens. It was overpriced and not in a very safe area.The $8 per day charge for parking was unbelievable. On the positive side, it is near the Van Nuys airport and there was ample hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Airtel Plaza for a convention and was paying about $85 a night! The room was spacious and clean! The pool area was clean, nothing special but it was good if you wanted to sunbathe or just take a swim. As is it right beside Van Nuys airport there are jets and private planes taking off ever few minutes but I didn't find it annoying....it would depend if that was something that would bother you. There is a spa area in a quiet area of the hotel, next to the gym which was nice. There are some nice rockery ponds which I found very relaxing and lovely to look at! I never ventured very far out of the hotel so I am not sure what there is to do in the surrounding area, I didn't feel it was that safe once it was dark and there were not any eating places about that I saw - I just ordered take away to the hotel - they just brought it straight to my room. The resturant in the hotel was reasonably priced for the quality food that you got....I had a lovely meal there, thought it was worth the money! The complimentary breakfast weren't that nice, the food didn't seem to keep hot. There were cereals to choose from and some donuts, croissants and small muffins which filled you up which was all I was looking for and it was free so I didn't expect much more! The Staff were very helpful and nice at all times, they were there to help with any problems. Overall this was a nice hotel to stay in, I was very happy. I would say it was the area that let the hotel down the most!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Aztecos
Reviews.Content: Our relatives on a tour from France were booked at this hotel for one night. We came from Orange County to meet them there and to take them to Universal City a 20 minute drive away depending on traffic. Our room was large, clean, and equipped with a hair dryer, iron, ironing board, coffee maker, tv, and clock. We booked with travelocity and paid $109. There isn't much in the area at a cheaper rate - I looked!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Travel_momColorado
Reviews.Content: In general the room was nice and clean. I enjoyed the Bath & Body works soaps, and the staff cleaned it nicely the next day. The beds were not very comfortable. The pool was very nice, especially after walking around all day Sightseeing. It was nice to have a warm pool and a HOT tub to soak in. The pool area it self was a little tacky, and the hallways were very dirty and stained. It didn't look like anyone had vacuumed them in over a week. The area around the hotel was dirty and seemed very unsafe. We got a little lost and ended up in an ally 2 blocks from the hotel, and there were old matresses, old couches, trash, broken down cars all over the place. We were trying to get out of the area around Hollywood, and stay somewhere a little nicer. Not. Having to pay to park was irritating. If there was some sort of security walking around all the time it probably wouldn't have been as irritating, but I saw no one- other than the attendant in the little box at the entrance. I suppose this hotel got it's three stars due to the expensive restaraunt in the lobby, and the fitness/pool area. Better place for business travelers - not families. We paid a ridiculous $99/night off priceline. I would maybe spend $60 a night but not much more if I hadn't been stuck with it through priceline. It says it's a three star hotel. I give it two. there isn't anyplace close to eat, or clean for that matter. We ended up driving all the way to Sherman Oaks trying to find someplace that looked clean. The one cool thing was watching the planes take off and land. the Runway is literally a stone's throw from the hotel. No noise at night though. Area was quiet at night.
